alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 4:03PM EDT until September 29 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a feeder band developing over southeast Miami-Dade County with rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches on top of the already 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen over these areas from previous feeder bands. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homestead, Homestead Miami Speedway, Black Point, The Redland, Turkey Point, Kendall, Florida City, Naranja, Homestead Base, Princeton, Leisure City, Goulds, Cutler Bay, Homestead Bayfront Park, Richmond West, West Perrine, Zoo Miami, Country Walk, Richmond Heights and Palmetto Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
